result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah Russ Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.314(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prohibited of new approvals under Chapter 29.

charges.descr: Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah Russ Phillips

records.descr: Notice to DNR of court ordered revocation
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaiah Russ Phillips in court.  Attorney Robert A Kennedy Jr. in court for Isaiah Russ Phillips. State resolution guilty to count one, $1000 fine plus court costs, 3 year prohibition on licenses under chapter 29. Kennedy agrees, makes statement in regards to the prohibitions on tribal lands. Court questions if he looked into that issue. Kennedy responds. Phillips understands and agrees. Phillips pleads guilty. Court has PLQ, goes over the form with the defendant. Phillips now makes statements to the court. Discussion if Phillips would like to accept the joint recommendation. Phillips would like to proceed. Court continues going through the form. Again Phillips questions the court on some of the issues of the PLQ. Court continues with PLQ, court finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial, factual basis exists, court accepts plea of guilty and adjudges guilty of count one as alleged. State no criminal history and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Kennedy makes statement. Phillips makes statement, questions the district attorney. Court explains he can make a statement not direct question to the DA. State puts on the record that he was not the officer that arrested the defendant. Phillips continues with statement. Court has considered all statements and factors, will follow joint recommendation and sentences to the following: Count 1 - imposes fine of $1000 fine plus costs, prohibit of new approvals under chapter 29 for 3 years, apply bond posted, remainder due 60 DTP/CO. Appeal rights given. DNA sample with surcharges. Kennedy questions about getting the gun back. State sent an email, believes the DNR has the gun. Court instructs to check with DNR.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:03 PM Defendant Isaiah Russ Phillips in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State - here for PLEAS. Kennedy - tried to contact defendant telephonically for this hearing but states his phone did not work, short turn around for scheduling this matter. Court responds. State - not sure how it got on the calendar today. Clerk informs the the JA put the matter on the record. State asks for bench warrant, body or $150.00. Kennedy responds, asks for an adjournment. Court will issue a bench warrant, body or $150.00,
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:17 AM Defendant Isaiah Russ Phillips in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State - resolved - plead G to count #1 as alleged with a fine of $1,000.00 plus costs and not to hold any hunting or fishing license for  3 years. Kennedy agrees but states that the firearm that was seized in the arrest be returned and suggested how that can be done. Phillips agrees, pleads G to only count. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it,  defendant interrupts and now states that he wants to take this matter to Triba Court. Discussion on that, Court does not believe that FCPC Tribal Court does not have criminal law to handle this matter. Defendant thought today was the trial for Court to make the decision to take this matter to Tribal Court. Recess at 9:24 AM to allow Kennedy to talk to his client. Back on record at 9:28 AM with same appearances. Kennedy suggests an adournment for stated reasons. Court will grant an adjournment - set for JT. Adjurned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:23 AM Defendant Isaiah Russ Phillips in court and appears with Attorney Robert Kennedy.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by video. CC and CR appear by video. Kennedy has went over complaint and enters NG plea to sole count. Court accepts plea and will be set on the JT calendar, if resolved contact JA for PLEAS date. State asks for $100 signature bond. Court imposes $100 signature bond.
